dc:description.@value: The Palimpsest License is a future-proof, layered licensing framework designed for creative work in the age of AI. It protects creators who work with narrative, trauma, mythology, and symbolic expression while addressing modern challenges like AI training, emotional lineage, and quantum-proof traceability. This license balances remix culture with exploitation prevention, supports DAO governance for collective assets, and preserves the emotional and cultural context of creative works.

De Palimpsest Licentie is een toekomstbestendig, gelaagd licentiekader ontworpen voor creatief werk in het tijdperk van AI. Het beschermt makers die werken met narratief, trauma, mythologie en symbolische expressie, terwijl het moderne uitdagingen aanpakt zoals AI-training, emotionele afstamming en quantumbestendige traceerbaarheid. Deze licentie balanceert remixcultuur met het voorkomen van uitbuiting, ondersteunt DAO-governance voor collectieve activa en behoudt de emotionele en culturele context van creatieve werken.

dc:contributor: Legal Experts in IP, Dutch, and Scottish Law (2)
AI Ethics and Decentralised Systems Technologist (1)
dc:rights: Licensed under the Palimpsest License v0.4
dcterms:abstract: A license born not just from copyright, but from care. From narrative debt. From cultural refusal. From emotional fidelity. The Palimpsest License protects Original Works that resist flattening while enabling reuse and remixing, safeguarding emotional resonance, cultural context, and symbolic depth.
dcterms:conformsTo: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set, Version 1.1
dcterms:provenance: Developed through community consultation and governance by the Palimpsest Stewardship Council, building upon v0.3 with enhanced protections for AI-era creative work.
dcterms:bibliographicCitation: Palimpsest Stewardship Council. (2025). Palimpsest License v0.4. Retrieved from https://palimpsest.license/v0.4
dcterms:tableOfContents: Clause 0: Purpose; Clause 1: Attribution; Clause 2: Remixing; Clause 3: Commercial Use; Clause 4: Jurisdiction and Enforcement; Clause 5: Accessibility Ethos; Clause 6: AGI/Synthetic Compatibility; Clause 7: Translation; Clause 8: Symbolic Defence; Clause 9: Termination; Clause 10: Evolution
dcterms:accrualPolicy: Proposals require 30-day consultation, Council review (4/7 votes), and final ratification (5/7 votes)
